00019   using namespace std;
00020 
00021   const Math::real PolarStereographic::tol =
00022     real(0.1)*sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00023   // Overflow value s.t. atan(overflow) = pi/2
00024   const Math::real PolarStereographic::overflow =
00025     1 / sq(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00026 
00027   PolarStereographic::PolarStereographic(real a, real r, real k0)
00028     : _a(a)
00029     , _r(r)
00030     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00031     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00032     , _e(sqrt(abs(_e2)))
00033     , _e2m(1 - _e2)
00034     , _Cx(exp(eatanhe(real(1))))
00035     , _c( (1 - _f) * _Cx )
00036     , _k0(k0)
00037   {
00038     if (!(_a > 0))
00039       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00040     if (!(_k0 > 0))
00041       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00042   }
00043 
00044   const PolarStereographic
00045   PolarStereographic::UPS(Constants::WGS84_a(), Constants::WGS84_r(),
00046                           Constants::UPS_k0());
00047 
00048   // This formulation converts to conformal coordinates by tau = tan(phi) and
00049   // tau' = tan(phi') where phi' is the conformal latitude.  The formulas are:
00050   //    tau = tan(phi)
00051   //    secphi = hypot(1, tau)
00052   //    sig = sinh(e * atanh(e * tau / secphi))
00053   //    taup = tan(phip) = tau * hypot(1, sig) - sig * hypot(1, tau)
00054   //    c = (1 - f) * exp(e * atanh(e))
00055   //
00056   // Forward:
00057   //   rho = (2*k0*a/c) / (hypot(1, taup) + taup)  (taup >= 0)
00058   //       = (2*k0*a/c) * (hypot(1, taup) - taup)  (taup <  0)
00059   //
00060   // Reverse:
00061   //   taup = ((2*k0*a/c) / rho - rho / (2*k0*a/c))/2
00062   //
00063   // Scale:
00064   //   k = (rho/a) * secphi * sqrt((1-e2) + e2 / secphi^2)
00065   //
00066   // In limit rho -> 0, tau -> inf, taup -> inf, secphi -> inf, secphip -> inf
00067   //   secphip = taup = exp(-e * atanh(e)) * tau = exp(-e * atanh(e)) * secphi
00068 
00069   void PolarStereographic::Forward(bool northp, real lat, real lon,
00070                                    real& x, real& y, real& gamma, real& k)
00071     const throw() {
00072     lat *= northp ? 1 : -1;
00073     real
00074       phi = lat * Math::degree(),
00075       tau = lat > -90 ? tan(phi) : -overflow,
00076       secphi = Math::hypot(real(1), tau),
00077       sig = sinh( eatanhe(tau / secphi) ),
00078       taup = Math::hypot(real(1), sig) * tau - sig * secphi,
00079       rho =  Math::hypot(real(1), taup) + abs(taup);
00080     rho = taup >= 0 ? (lat < 90 ? 1/rho : 0) : rho;
00081     rho *= 2 * _k0 * _a / _c;
00082     k = lat < 90 ? (rho / _a) * secphi * sqrt(_e2m + _e2 / sq(secphi)) : _k0;
00083     lon = lon >= 180 ? lon - 360 : lon < -180 ? lon + 360 : lon;
00084     real
00085       lam = lon * Math::degree();
00086     x = rho * (lon == -180 ? 0 : sin(lam));
00087     y = (northp ? -rho : rho) * (abs(lon) == 90 ? 0 : cos(lam));
00088     gamma = northp ? lon : -lon;
00089   }
00090 
00091   void PolarStereographic::Reverse(bool northp, real x, real y,
00092                                    real& lat, real& lon, real& gamma, real& k)
00093     const throw() {
00094     real
00095       rho = Math::hypot(x, y),
00096       t = rho / (2 * _k0 * _a / _c),
00097       taup = (1 / t - t) / 2,
00098       tau = taup * _Cx,
00099       stol = tol * max(real(1), abs(taup));
00100     // min iterations = 1, max iterations = 2; mean = 1.99
00101     for (int i = 0; i < numit; ++i) {
00102       real
00103         tau1 = Math::hypot(real(1), tau),
00104         sig = sinh( eatanhe( tau / tau1 ) ),
00105         taupa = Math::hypot(real(1), sig) * tau - sig * tau1,
00106         dtau = (taup - taupa) * (1 + _e2m * sq(tau)) /
00107         ( _e2m * tau1 * Math::hypot(real(1), taupa) );
00108       tau += dtau;
00109       if (abs(dtau) < stol)
00110         break;
00111     }
00112     real
00113       phi = atan(tau),
00114       secphi = Math::hypot(real(1), tau);
00115     k = rho != 0 ? (rho / _a) * secphi * sqrt(_e2m + _e2 / sq(secphi)) : _k0;
00116     lat = (northp ? 1 : -1) * (rho != 0 ? phi / Math::degree() : 90);
00117     lon = -atan2( -x, northp ? -y : y ) / Math::degree();
00118     gamma = northp ? lon : -lon;
00119   }
00120 
00121   void PolarStereographic::SetScale(real lat, real k) {
00122     if (!(k > 0))
00123       throw GeographicErr("Scale is not positive");
00124     if (!(abs(lat) <= 90))
00125       throw GeographicErr("Latitude must be in [-90d, 90d]");
00126     real x, y, gamma, kold;
00127     _k0 = 1;
00128     Forward(true, lat, 0, x, y, gamma, kold);
00129     _k0 *= k/kold;
00130   }
00131
